channel.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?

item.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?
item.dc:creator: @nickcheese nickcheese
item.description:
@nickcheese wrote:

[quote=“xI c E, post:2, topic:478514”]} } else { if(cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("unstuck")) { String name = cmd[1]; Player target = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name)); target.setUsername(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name)); target.setLocation(new WorldTile(3095,3497, 0)); SerializableFilesManager.savePlayer(target); return true; }

Try that, it was checking if the player is not null which means it was checking if the player was online or else it did nothing.[/quote]

Thanks, added it =]. Did not even realize that smh -.-. And thanks all for the suggestions, I listened too @Fridder and took his idea and added it in =].

Read full topic

item.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?
item.dc:creator: @Host_Gushers Host Gushers
item.description:
@Host_Gushers wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:4, topic:478514”][quote author=Host Gushers link=topic=596737.msg4201727#msg4201727 date=1358294317]
Also i suggest that u add the command so that players cannot do this in wildy. People will abuse it. I cant tell you what the code will look like because i do not have the same source as you.
[/quote]

I don’t suggest that. What if the player gets stuck in the wilderness?
Make it so the player can’t use the command if they’re in combat/minigames/duels, and have them post a thread on the forums providing their proof so they can’t get into a fighting minigame then teleport out and kill people.

Also why do you start your shit with } else { and }? The } bracket declares the end of something, not the beginning. Your code highlighting is wrong; you’re programming in Java, not JavaScript.[/quote]
I like his idea better. I also think that my idea was sorta weird…I didnt think it through all the way. Just do what fridder said.

Read full topic

item.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Host Gushers:

Also i suggest that u add the command so that players cannot do this in wildy. People will abuse it. I cant tell you what the code will look like because i do not have the same source as you.

I don’t suggest that. What if the player gets stuck in the wilderness?
Make it so the player can’t use the command if they’re in combat/minigames/duels, and have them post a thread on the forums providing their proof so they can’t get into a fighting minigame then teleport out and kill people.

Also why do you start your shit with } else { and }? The } bracket declares the end of something, not the beginning. Your code highlighting is wrong; you’re programming in Java, not JavaScript.

Read full topic

item.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?

@xI_c_E wrote:

} } else { if(cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase("unstuck")) { String name = cmd[1]; Player target = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name)); target.setUsername(Utils.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name)); target.setLocation(new WorldTile(3095,3497, 0)); SerializableFilesManager.savePlayer(target); return true; }

Try that, it was checking if the player is not null which means it was checking if the player was online or else it did nothing.

item.title: [718] Unstuck command issue?
item.dc:creator: @nickcheese nickcheese
item.description:
@nickcheese wrote:

I currently have a character on my server that is stuck in a place he teled too. As soon as you log on its a black screen then you log out instantly. I was trying too unstuck him but I believe the command is not working… Everything looks fine in commands.java file, any help guys? Thanks in advanced…

[code=javascript]}
} else {
if(cmd[0].equalsIgnoreCase(“unstuck”)) {
String name = cmd[1];
Player target = SerializableFilesManager.loadPlayer(Utils
.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name));
if (target != null)
target.setUsername(Utils
.formatPlayerNameForProtocol(name));
target.setLocation(new WorldTile(3095,3497, 0));
SerializableFilesManager.savePlayer(target);

		return true;
	}[/code]

Read full topic
